DataElement.preferredName: Protocol Deviation Reviewed By Sponsor Defined Role Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A sponsor defined name to describe the role of the deviation reviewer.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A variation from processes or procedures defined in a protocol. Deviations usually do not preclude the overall evaluability of subject data for either efficacy or safety, and are often acknowledged and accepted in advance by the sponsor. (CDISC Glossary)_Indicates the person or authoritative body who appraised, evaluated, or analyzed the item.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An unintended departure from the study plan which has not been prospectively reviewed and approved by the IRB and FDA.

Concepts.definition: A variation from processes or procedures defined in a protocol. Deviations usually do not preclude the overall evaluability of subject data for either efficacy or safety, and are often acknowledged and accepted in advance by the sponsor. (CDISC Glossary)

Property.preferredDefinition: Indicates the person or authoritative body who appraised, evaluated, or analyzed the item.

Concepts.definition: Indicates the person or authoritative body who appraised, evaluated, or analyzed the item.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 3/14/2023Unretired CDE for Protocol Deviations form per CTSU.LS07.05.22_Retired as part of quarterly metric clean-up_ghd

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_A concise explanation of the meaning of a word or phrase or symbol._The usual or expected function of something; the part something plays in an action or event._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person trained in pharmacy that prepares and dispenses drugs prescribed by physicians and health practitioners. The responsibilities include instructing patients on the use, hazards, interactions, and side effects of any drug dispensed.

Concepts.definition: A person trained in pharmacy that prepares and dispenses drugs prescribed by physicians and health practitioners. The responsibilities include instructing patients on the use, hazards, interactions, and side effects of any drug dispensed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The operations and access levels which are allowed to a user (e.g Create, Read, Update, Delete).: Permission that allows a user or program the ability to view information.

Concepts.definition: The operations and access levels which are allowed to a user (e.g Create, Read, Update, Delete).
Permission that allows a user or program the ability to view information.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Clinical Trial Site Clinical Trial Auditor

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Clinical Trial Site Clinical Trial Auditor
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any healthcare organization, institution, facility or provider directly involved in conducting or facilitating a particular clinical trial.: A person who audits and monitors a clinical trial. Duties include reviews of protocols and amendments, verification of proper reporting, auditing and monitoring study data, including the consent process, eligibility criteria, and case report forms, generation of audit reports.

Concepts.definition: Any healthcare organization, institution, facility or provider directly involved in conducting or facilitating a particular clinical trial.

A person who audits and monitors a clinical trial. Duties include reviews of protocols and amendments, verification of proper reporting, auditing and monitoring study data, including the consent process, eligibility criteria, and case report forms, generation of audit reports.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The principal administrative organization responsible for the research conducted.: A person who audits and monitors a clinical trial. Duties include reviews of protocols and amendments, verification of proper reporting, auditing and monitoring study data, including the consent process, eligibility criteria, and case report forms, generation of audit reports.

Concepts.definition: The principal administrative organization responsible for the research conducted.

A person who audits and monitors a clinical trial. Duties include reviews of protocols and amendments, verification of proper reporting, auditing and monitoring study data, including the consent process, eligibility criteria, and case report forms, generation of audit reports.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person who audits and monitors a clinical trial. Duties include reviews of protocols and amendments, verification of proper reporting, auditing and monitoring study data, including the consent process, eligibility criteria, and case report forms, generation of audit reports.

Concepts.definition: A person who audits and monitors a clinical trial. Duties include reviews of protocols and amendments, verification of proper reporting, auditing and monitoring study data, including the consent process, eligibility criteria, and case report forms, generation of audit reports.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The operations and access levels which are allowed to a user (e.g Create, Read, Update, Delete).: Permission that allows a user or program the ability to view information, modify and add information, and delete information.

Concepts.definition: The operations and access levels which are allowed to a user (e.g Create, Read, Update, Delete).
Permission that allows a user or program the ability to view information, modify and add information, and delete information.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: User Privilege Read Permission All Clinical Trial Site

ValueMeaning.preferredName: User Privilege Read Permission All Clinical Trial Site
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The operations and access levels which are allowed to a user (e.g Create, Read, Update, Delete).: Permission that allows a user or program the ability to view information.: To a complete degree or to the full or entire extent.: Any healthcare organization, institution, facility or provider directly involved in conducting or facilitating a particular clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: The operations and access levels which are allowed to a user (e.g Create, Read, Update, Delete).
Permission that allows a user or program the ability to view information.
To a complete degree or to the full or entire extent.
Any healthcare organization, institution, facility or provider directly involved in conducting or facilitating a particular clinical trial.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Recording of data by human or automated action where an electronic record is the original means of capturing the data into an electronic records system without a paper source document. Examples are an individual keying original observations into a system or the automatic recording into the system of the output from measuring devices such as a balance that measures subject's body weight or an ECG machine. Compare to data entry, data acquisition.

Concepts.definition: Recording of data by human or automated action where an electronic record is the original means of capturing the data into an electronic records system without a paper source document. Examples are an individual keying original observations into a system or the automatic recording into the system of the output from measuring devices such as a balance that measures subject's body weight or an ECG machine. Compare to data entry, data acquisition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person primarily responsible for database creation, data collection, validation, integration, coding, review, quality evaluation, and archiving, as well as for preparation of reports and data displays.: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: The process by which original, source data is inputed by a human into a digital, structured format for later use and analysis.

Concepts.definition: A person primarily responsible for database creation, data collection, validation, integration, coding, review, quality evaluation, and archiving, as well as for preparation of reports and data displays.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
The process by which original, source data is inputed by a human into a digital, structured format for later use and analysis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: Be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Be specific about something; define clearly.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Clinical Research Associate Laboratory Administrative Activity

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Clinical Research Associate Laboratory Administrative Activity
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person who is employed by a study sponsor or by a contract research organization (CRO), operates independently from the clinical study site and functions as a monitor, and/or auditor, and/or a project director within a particular trial or institution.: A facility equipped and competent to conduct scientific experiments, observations, tests, investigations, and/or to manufacture chemicals or medical products.: Activities involved in the performance of executive, supervisory, or managerial duties.

Concepts.definition: A person who is employed by a study sponsor or by a contract research organization (CRO), operates independently from the clinical study site and functions as a monitor, and/or auditor, and/or a project director within a particular trial or institution.
A facility equipped and competent to conduct scientific experiments, observations, tests, investigations, and/or to manufacture chemicals or medical products.
Activities involved in the performance of executive, supervisory, or managerial duties.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person who is employed by a study sponsor or by a contract research organization (CRO), operates independently from the clinical study site and functions as a monitor, and/or auditor, and/or a project director within a particular trial or institution.

Concepts.definition: A person who is employed by a study sponsor or by a contract research organization (CRO), operates independently from the clinical study site and functions as a monitor, and/or auditor, and/or a project director within a particular trial or institution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person primarily responsible for database creation, data collection, validation, integration, coding, review, quality evaluation, and archiving, as well as for preparation of reports and data displays.

Concepts.definition: A person primarily responsible for database creation, data collection, validation, integration, coding, review, quality evaluation, and archiving, as well as for preparation of reports and data displays.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A top-level manager who is responsible for the running of a clinical trial, usually overseeing the day-to-day activities.

Concepts.definition: A top-level manager who is responsible for the running of a clinical trial, usually overseeing the day-to-day activities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An investigator designated to a specific study location.

Concepts.definition: An investigator designated to a specific study location.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person who is responsible for providing overall management for the operation of the study, and for reporting to the Data and Safety Monitoring Board. The continual review of the data by an independent individual or DSMB assures the investigator(s) that the trial can continue without jeopardizing patient safety.

Concepts.definition: A person who is responsible for providing overall management for the operation of the study, and for reporting to the Data and Safety Monitoring Board. The continual review of the data by an independent individual or DSMB assures the investigator(s) that the trial can continue without jeopardizing patient safety.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.
